Page.title: Home
Page._content:
Run AI Anywhere — With Metal Performance

QBO brings orchestrated GPUs, Kubernetes, and container infrastructure to your data center, edge, or private cloud.

AI Workloads, Unlocked — On Your Metal, Partner Metal, or Ours

No VMs. No noise. Just fast, orchestrated GPU infrastructure for real AI workloads.

Turn Metal into Revenue — Fast

QBO makes your servers GPU-cloud ready. One platform. All your tenants. Maximum ROI.

Schedule a Discovery Meeting

Trusted by leading AI labs, platforms, and enterprises

QBO, Purpose-Built for AI at the Edge

Experience no-compromise metal performance and unlock the full potential of your AI innovations with QBO at the edge.

QBO delivers metal-level performance with Kubernetes-in-Docker and Docker-in-Docker solutions, ensuring unmatched efficiency for AI workloads.

With QBO, all infrastructure dependencies—including DNS, Load Balancing, Firewall, Authentication, ACME, and more— are fully integrated, simplifying deployment and management.

Build GPU clouds with just servers, high-performance network cards, and switches, and at a fraction of the cost of hyperscalers.

Deploy on-prem, in the public cloud, at the edge, or in airgapped environments—with total control and flexibility.

Explore QBO’s GPU Cloud Services

Maximize your potential with QBO and accelerate your time to market, so you can focus on what you do best: building, training, and deploying AI models
that are transforming the world.

QBO Kubernetes Engine

QKE delivers a powerful Kubernetes environment powered by KinD
(Kubernetes in Docker), optimized with the NVIDIA GPU Operator

QBO Kubernetes Engine

  • Experience next-generation Kubernetes with QKE, a high-performance platform built on KinD (Kubernetes in Docker) and enhanced with the NVIDIA GPU Operator.
  • Deploy and manage clusters at scale with seamless GPU acceleration for AI/ML workloads. QKE delivers upstream Kubernetes with Kubeflow-ready support, full CNCF certification, and compatibility with the latest distributions.
  • QKE runs with metal-like performance—optimized for GPU, disk, network, and memory—while packaging all critical infrastructure dependencies: networking, security, storage, and observability. No external services required.
  • Unlock the full potential of containerized AI—deployed at the edge or anywhere

QBO Container Engine

QCE simplifies container management with Docker-in-Docker powered by the NVIDIA Container Toolkit.

QBO Container Engine

  • QCE simplifies container orchestration with Docker-in-Docker, fully integrated with the NVIDIA Container Toolkit for seamless GPU acceleration.
  • Deploy, scale, and manage compute instances effortlessly—all with metal-level performance for GPU, disk, network, and memory.
  • Ideal for 3D design, virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI), video editing, CUDA development, and even high-performance gaming—QCE brings GPU-intensive workloads to life in containers.
  • With self-contained networking, security, storage, and observability, QCE requires no external dependencies—just pure performance.
  • QCE powers the next generation of compute instances and workstations—delivered in containers, accelerated by GPUs, and ready for the edge.

QBO, a New Approach to Cloud Computing

Zero Virtualization. Pure Containers. Unparalleled Metal Performance with QBO

Apps

Supports any application running on Linux or Kubernetes, including Linux and Windows workstations. Ideal for resource-intensive or real-time workloads that demand direct access to GPU, CPU, RAM, and disk — delivering bare-metal performance without virtualization overhead.
From 3D design and video editing to AI/ML, gaming, and data processing, QBO ensures optimal performance across diverse use cases.

QBO AsyncAPI

Transforms bare-metal servers into a full-featured cloud computing platform by orchestrating containers, workloads, and infrastructure services through an event-driven architecture. QBO AsyncAPI enables dynamic compute provisioning, real-time API communication, and seamless scaling across distributed environments — all without relying on external cloud dependencies.

QBO GPU Cloud

A high-performance cloud environment built for GPU-accelerated workloads.

Kubernetes-in-Docker (KinD) Kubernetes Engine: Deploy full Kubernetes clusters inside containers for isolated, reproducible environments.

Docker-in-Docker (DinD) Container Engine: Launch containerized compute instances with GPU support, ideal for standalone tasks or lightweight virtual workstations.

Self-contained infrastructure dependencies: Includes integrated Networking, Security, Storage, and Observability — no external cloud services required.

Bare Metal Servers

Hardware and architecture-agnostic: QBO runs on any x86 or ARM server, regardless of vendor or configuration. No specialized hardware or virtualization layer is required — just Linux.

Designed for AI workloads at the edge

Accelerate AI Infrastructure

10–15x

Faster

QBO accelerates AI infrastructure by up to 96% compared to virtualized clouds. Deploy a 3-node cluster in 70 seconds vs. 15 minutes with hyperscalers.
Launch compute instances in sub-seconds, and scale infrastructure 10× faster — all with dramatically simpler management.


With QBO, you deploy, scale, and adapt faster than ever — leaving traditional hyperscalers behind.

Save on Cost Compared to Any Hyperscaler

75%+

Savings

QBO reduces cloud costs by up to 75% compared to traditional hyperscalers — without sacrificing performance.
Benefit from built-in services like DNS, load balancing, networking, and core infrastructure, all included by default.


There are no hidden fees, no premium charges for basic services, and no billing surprises — just predictable, efficient infrastructure at a fraction of the cost.

Do More with Less Hardware

10x

Density

QBO delivers up to 10× greater Kubernetes density by running clusters in lightweight containers rather than full virtual machines.
Where traditional setups may fit 15 Kubernetes VMs on a server, QBO can host 150 KinD-based clusters on the same hardware — with full isolation, native performance, and zero virtualization overhead.

Streamline Deployments

5 Minutes

Setup

All infrastructure dependencies are fully self-contained within QBO, allowing you to spin up a complete cloud environment in minutes — without relying on any external services.


This includes critical components such as Firewall, Load Balancer, DNS, User Management, Authentication, ACME, and more — all integrated and ready out of the box.


With QBO, deployment is no longer a complex assembly of third-party tools — it’s a single, unified platform built for speed and simplicity.

Bring Your Own Cloud

100%

Portability

With QBO, you can deploy your infrastructure anywhere — on-premises, in the public cloud, at the edge, or even in air-gapped environments — with complete mobility and control.


This flexibility ensures data sovereignty, simplifies compliance with regulatory requirements, and enhances security by letting you choose where and how your data and workloads are deployed.


Whether for enterprise, government, or regulated industries, QBO gives you the freedom to build your cloud on your terms.

Maximum Performance for AI/ML, Real-Time, and High I/O Workloads

100%

Metal Performance

QBO delivers bare-metal speed for AI/ML training, inference, real-time processing, and data-intensive workloads — with zero virtualization overhead.


Achieve native-level performance for the most demanding applications, including GPU-accelerated compute, low-latency inference, and high-throughput I/O pipelines.


With QBO, you get direct access to hardware, maximizing resource efficiency and ensuring deterministic performance where it matters most.

Leading AI Innovators Trust QBO

“QBO exhibits metal performance across the board with all our ML/AI workloads.”

Simon McCormack VP Product, Drut

“With QBO, we took our Kubernetes cluster build-time down from 9 minutes to 70 seconds. It’s mind-blowing; I’ve never seen anything like it!”

Graham McGuiness Jigsaw24

“I don’t understand it cause in theory, it (a 60-second deployment) shouldn’t be possible!”

Riccardo Berardone Mobiliti Group

“To be able to deliver on our GTM strategy, we needed a lower and predictable infrastructure cost model, like QBO’s.”

Grahame Smee CEO, OpExx

CNCF Member and Conformance

QBO is a proud Silver Member of CNCF and Linux Foundation. QBO Kubernetes also aligns with the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) standards, ensuring adherence to best practices in cloud-native computing. This conformance establishes a solid foundation for interoperability.

Learn More

Page.title: About
Page._content:
GPU Cloud at the Edge Beyond

Delivering high performance, streamlined infrastructure, and flexible AI/ML deployment—wherever you need it.

Our Mission & Milestones

2023

2023 2024 2025

QBO was founded in 2023 to transform the cloud compute landscape.

QBO is a San Francisco–based technology company reimagining cloud infrastructure for AI and GPU-powered workloads. Built in the heart of the Financial District, QBO combines performance, simplicity, and sovereignty—enabling organizations to run high-performance compute anywhere.

Our founding team brings decades of experience from industry leaders such as Sysdig, Riverbed, NGINX, F5, Portworx, Pure Storage, Splunk, and Cisco. With deep roots in cloud, data infrastructure, observability, and scalable systems, we’re building infrastructure that meets the demands of modern AI—without the complexity of legacy cloud providers.

Our Vision

To democratize access to high-performance GPU compute, empowering innovators of all backgrounds to create, build, and scale without technical or financial barriers.

Page.title: videos
Page._content:
See Innovation in Motion

Watch stories, how-tos, and deep dives that bring QBO’s technology and vision to life—powered by community, built for the future.

Data Sovereignty, Residency, & Localisation

Data sovereignty, residency, and localization aren’t just buzzwords—they’re critical compliance requirements with distinct differences.

VMware Alternative with QBO

QBO runs container-native directly on bare metal, no hypervisor, no VM overhead, which makes QBO a perfect fit for high-performance AI workloads.

QBO Intro video

Watch QBO transform bare metal into powerful cloud platform, all without virtualization layer and overhead

QBO + Plasma Web Desktop

Deploy a docker based plasma web desktop workstation with access to GPU in minutes on QBO. Perfect for CUDA development, VFX, graphic design, gaming and more

QBO + Kubeflow

Deploy Kubeflow with Nvidia GPU Operator support in part 2 of “Unlocking AI & ML Metal Performance with QBO Kubernetes Engine (QKE)”

QBO + NVIDIA GPU Operator

Set up the Nvidia GPU Operator in part 1 of “Unlocking AI & ML Metal Performance with QBO Kubernetes Engine (QKE)”

Running GitLab on QBO - A High-Performance, Portable Solution

This guide provides a comprehensive walkthrough for deploying *GitLab* on **QBO**, leveraging its powerful features such as **integrated load balancing**, **automated wildcard TLS certificates**, and **MinIO as a backend for GitLab’s container registry**.

ArgoCD on QBO - Future-Proofing CI/CD with QBO & ArgoCD

In today’s rapidly evolving cloud-native landscape, flexibility and scalability are non-negotiable. **ArgoCD**, a declarative GitOps continuous delivery tool, is a game-changer for Kubernetes. But when combined with **QBO**, an innovative Kubernetes platform that bridges the gap between on-prem, private, and public cloud environments—including air-gapped deployments—it becomes a powerhouse for modern CI/CD workflows.

Page.title: why-qbo
Page._content:
The Future of Edge Cloud Solutions

Transform your infrastructure that works on your terms

Schedule a Discovery Meeting

No-Compromise Metal Performance with QBO, Purpose-Built for AI at the Edge

QBO delivers metal-level performance with Kubernetes-in-Docker and Docker-in-Docker solutions, ensuring unmatched efficiency for AI workloads.

With QBO, all infrastructure dependencies—including DNS, Load Balancing, Firewall, Authentication, ACME, and more—are fully integrated, simplifying deployment and management.

Build GPU clouds with just servers, high-performance network cards, and switches, and at a fraction of the cost of hyperscalers.

Deploy on-prem, in the public cloud, at the edge, or in airgapped environments—with total control and flexibility.

Unlock the full potential of your AI innovations with QBO at the edge.

Experience the QBO Difference

Our edge cloud solutions provide enterprises with the scalability of public cloud, the control of private cloud, the flexibility of hybrid cloud, the cost efficiency of large capital expenditure (CapEx), and the agility of optimized operational expenditure (OpEx).

Learn More

Deploy Cloud Anywhere

TTurn any bare-metal server into a fully functional cloud platform, whether it’s: - On-premises for security and control. - At the edge for ultra-low latency and performance. - In a colocation facility to leverage dedicated infrastructure. - In a hybrid-cloud model to connect seamlessly across environments.

Scale Like Public Cloud, Control Like Private Cloud

Gain complete control while maintaining cloud-like scalability: - No virtualization overhead – Direct hardware access ensures peak performance. - Full workload isolation – Unlike shared infrastructure, every process runs independently. - Self-contained architecture – No reliance on external dependencies like DNS, firewalls, or load balancers.

The Best of CapEx and OpEx

Combine CapEx and OpEx strategies to reduce costs and optimize ROI: - Own hardware for long-term cost efficiency. - Scale on demand using flexible consumption models. - Pay for what you use without hyperscaler markups.

Avoid Vendor Lock-In with Open-Source Compatibility

QBO is CNCF Kubernetes-certified, meaning it runs Kubernetes-native applications without modification. Enterprises can: - Move workloads freely between cloud providers. - Avoid being locked into proprietary hyperscaler services. - Leverage open standards instead of vendor-controlled infrastructure.

Security Without Third-Party Risks

Secure your own infrastructure without compromise: - Workloads fully isolated at the process level. - Air-gapped deployments, secure and offline operation for highly regulated industries. - No reliance on third-party security layers—enterprises maintain full control.

Leading AI Innovators Trust QBO

“QBO exhibits metal performance across the board with all our ML/AI workloads.”

Simon McCormack VP Product, Drut

“With QBO, we took our Kubernetes cluster build-time down from 9 minutes to 70 seconds. It’s mind-blowing; I’ve never seen anything like it!”

Graham McGuiness Jigsaw24

“I don’t understand it cause in theory, it (a 60-second deployment) shouldn’t be possible!”

Riccardo Berardone Mobiliti Group

“To be able to deliver on our GTM strategy, we needed a lower and predictable infrastructure cost model, like QBO’s.”

Grahame Smee CEO, OpExx

QBO, the catalyst for edge cloud evolution

Ready to rethink how you deploy and manage edge cloud infrastructure?

Request Demo

Ready to rethink how you deploy and manage edge cloud infrastructure?

Request Demo
Page.more:
The Future of Edge Cloud Solutions

Transform your infrastructure that works on your terms

Schedule a Discovery Meeting

No-Compromise Metal Performance with QBO, Purpose-Built for AI at the Edge

QBO delivers metal-level performance with Kubernetes-in-Docker and Docker-in-Docker solutions, ensuring unmatched efficiency for AI workloads.

With QBO, all infrastructure dependencies—including DNS, Load Balancing, Firewall, Authentication, ACME, and more—are fully integrated, simplifying deployment and management.

Build GPU clouds with just servers, high-performance network cards, and switches, and at a fraction of the cost of hyperscalers.

Deploy on-prem, in the public cloud, at the edge, or in airgapped environments—with total control and flexibility.

Unlock the full potential of your AI innovations with QBO at the edge.

Experience the QBO Difference

Our edge cloud solutions provide enterprises with the scalability of public cloud, the control of private cloud, the flexibility of hybrid cloud, the cost efficiency of large capital expenditure (CapEx), and the agility of optimized operational expenditure (OpEx).

Learn More

Deploy Cloud Anywhere

TTurn any bare-metal server into a fully functional cloud platform, whether it’s: - On-premises for security and control. - At the edge for ultra-low latency and performance. - In a colocation facility to leverage dedicated infrastructure. - In a hybrid-cloud model to connect seamlessly across environments.

Scale Like Public Cloud, Control Like Private Cloud

Gain complete control while maintaining cloud-like scalability: - No virtualization overhead – Direct hardware access ensures peak performance. - Full workload isolation – Unlike shared infrastructure, every process runs independently. - Self-contained architecture – No reliance on external dependencies like DNS, firewalls, or load balancers.

The Best of CapEx and OpEx

Combine CapEx and OpEx strategies to reduce costs and optimize ROI: - Own hardware for long-term cost efficiency. - Scale on demand using flexible consumption models. - Pay for what you use without hyperscaler markups.

Avoid Vendor Lock-In with Open-Source Compatibility

QBO is CNCF Kubernetes-certified, meaning it runs Kubernetes-native applications without modification. Enterprises can: - Move workloads freely between cloud providers. - Avoid being locked into proprietary hyperscaler services. - Leverage open standards instead of vendor-controlled infrastructure.

Security Without Third-Party Risks

Secure your own infrastructure without compromise: - Workloads fully isolated at the process level. - Air-gapped deployments, secure and offline operation for highly regulated industries. - No reliance on third-party security layers—enterprises maintain full control.

Powering Efficiency Across Sectors

QBO’s edge solution drives operational and cost efficiencies for diverse sectors – from Government and Utility & Energy to Media & Entertainment and Retail.

Schedule a Discovery Meeting

Enhance Mission-Critical Operations

Industry: Department of defense

Military operations require secure, reliable computing at the tactical edge for real-time decision making, while maintaining data sovereignty and ensuring mission success in disconnected environments.

Business applications
  1. Deploy AI-powered threat detection and response systems that operate autonomously in contested environments
  2. Enable secure data processing and analysis at the battlefield edge with zero-trust architecture
  3. Orchestrate multi-domain operations with resilient edge computing across air, land, sea, and space
Government (MoD & DoD)

Revolutionize Content Delivery

Content providers must deliver high-quality, low-latency streaming experiences while managing massive data volumes and adapting to dynamic viewer demands.

Business applications
  1. Enable real-time content processing and optimization at the network edge
  2. Deploy localized content caching and distribution networks for improved streaming performance
  3. Implement AI-driven content personalization and ad insertion at the edge
Media & Entertainment

Accelerate Intelligent Transportation Networks

Industry: Transportation

Transportation providers face mounting pressure to optimize fleet performance and prepare for autonomous operations—all while processing massive data volumes in real-time.

Business applications
  1. Deploy edge-based predictive analytics for vehicle maintenance, reducing downtime
  2. Implement edge-based traffic management systems that process sensor data locally to dynamically adjust signals, routing, and digital signage with minimal latency
  3. Deploy autonomous vehicle support infrastructure that processes safety-critical data at the edge even in connectivity-challenged environments
Transportation

Elevate Shopping Experience

Industry: Retail

Retailers must deliver personalized experiences while optimizing operations, managing inventory, and securing customer data across distributed store locations.

Business applications

Retail

Utility & Energy

Healthcare providers need secure, compliant computing solutions that enable real-time patient monitoring, rapid diagnostics, and seamless care coordination across facilities.

Business applications
  1. Process medical imaging and diagnostics locally with AI/ML while ensuring HIPAA compliance
  2. Enable remote patient monitoring with edge-based analytics and alerts
  3. Orchestrate secure data sharing between medical devices and healthcare systems

Page.title: Opexx Ionos Case Study
Page._content:
OpExx & IONOS

Customer Story

From AWS to QBO running on IONOS bare metal, OpExx Achieved a 40% Reduction on Total Cost of Ownership

This customer story explores the tremendous value that OpExx, a FinOps SaaS provider, gained by leveraging QBO and the IONOS Bare Metal Cloud to deliver its solution. Their journey demonstrates how this combination benefits OpExx by optimizing performance, reducing costs, and enhancing operational simplicity, compared to running on hyperscale public clouds.

The Challenge

OpExx, a provider of operational efficiency SaaS solutions, needed a robust infrastructure to support its growing customer base. Challenges included:

  • Cost Management: Escalating costs on hyperscale public clouds, including high performance data warehouse
  • Performance Requirements: Ensuring low latency and high throughput for real-time data processing and analytics
  • Operational Complexity: Reducing DevOps overhead to focus on innovation and scaling the SaaS solution

The Solution

OpExx migrated its SaaS operations to a solution built on:

  • IONOS Bare Metal Cloud: Delivering dedicated, high-performance hardware at predictable costs
  • QBO: Simplifying orchestration and enabling a PaaS-like environment on bare metal
  • Optimized Architecture: Designed to scale with OpExx’s SaaS workloads while maintaining cost efficiency and performance

Implementation

  1. Deployment on IONOS Bare Metal Cloud: Replaced hyperscale cloud instances with dedicated bare-metal servers provided by IONOS. Predictable pricing structures eliminated variable fees and simplified financial planning.
  2. Streamlined Orchestration with QBO: QBO transformed bare-metal servers into scalable environments for deploying and managing SaaS applications.
  3. Optimized SaaS Workloads: Real-time analytics, customer dashboards, and operational tools were fine-tuned to leverage the performance of bare-metal infrastructure.

Results

1. Cost Savings

Reduction in TCO: OpExx achieved a 40% cost reduction compared to hyperscale cloud expenses due to:

  • Eliminating egress fees and over-provisioning
  • Leveraging efficient resource allocation with QBO

2. Performance Improvements

  • Enhanced Application Responsiveness: Running directly on bare metal reduced latency by 25%, critical for real-time SaaS features like reporting
  • Increased Throughput: Dedicated hardware eliminated hypervisor resource contention

3. Operational Efficiency

  • DevOps Simplification: QBO’s orchestration reduced manual intervention, freeing OpExx’s team to focus on innovation
  • Scalability: Rapid deployment of new SaaS instances to meet growing demand

Comparison with Hyperscale Public Cloud

MetricIONOS+QBO+OpExxHyperscale Cloud
Cost TransparencyFixed pricing with no hidden feesVariable, with egress and overage costs
PerformanceBare-metal efficiencyVirtualized environments introduce latency
ScalabilityAutomated via QBORequires manual configuration or provider tools
SimplicityPaaS-ready with QBOComplex setup for equivalent performance

Conclusion

By leveraging QBO and IONOS Bare Metal Cloud, OpExx successfully transformed its SaaS delivery model, achieving significant cost savings, enhanced performance, and operational simplicity.

INDUSTRY:

Financial Operations SaaS

LOCATION/HQ:

Maidenhead, United Kingdom

“To be able to deliver on our GTM strategy, we needed a lower and predictable infrastructure cost model, like QBO’s.”

Grahame Smee
CEO, OpExx

Cloud IaaS

Berlin, Germany

Page.title: QBO Container Engine
Page._content:
QBO Container Engine

Unlock bare-metal performance while retaining the agility of cloud computing with QBO

Schedule a Discovery Meeting

High-Performance Computing

QBO Container Engine (QCE) is QBO’s service that offers compute instances. Traditional approaches that rely on virtual machines for compute introduce performance challenges and unnecessary overhead. Streamline the deployment and management of compute instances with subsecond deployments via QCE and Docker-in-Docker technology.

QBO Container Engine

Our QCE offers a high-performance, scalable solution for running compute instances—eliminating the performance overhead typically associated with virtual machines.

Subsecond Deployments

Unlike traditional VM-based approaches, QCE enables subsecond deployments, dramatically accelerating time-to-market for your workloads.

Metal Cloud Compute (MC2)

MC2 delivers metal-level compute performance with direct access to hardware resources, powered by NVIDIA GPUs and a shell-based interface. Perfect for high-performance workloads, AI/ML, real-time applications, or CUDA development that demand low-latency, high-throughput computation.

Docker-in-Docker Technology

Built on Docker-in-Docker technology, QCE streamlines the deployment and management of compute instances, ensuring fast, efficient, and consistent resource provisioning.

Plasma Workstation

Plasma Workstations offer high-performance, virtualized desktop environments with full GPU acceleration.Tailored for professionals in AI/ML development, design, rendering, and CUDA development who need powerful, flexible computing resources.

Windows Workstations

Windows Workstations provide GPU-accelerated, Windows-based virtual environments. Ideal for AI/ML developers and data scientists who need robust computing power for Windows applications, legacy software, and modern workloads. Access high-performance Windows environments with a familiar interface—perfect for productivity, research, and compute-heavy tasks.

QBO Plasma Web Desktop application

Experience unparalleled metal performance with QBO’s web desktop powered by NVIDIA GPUs. Perfect for CUDA development, gaming, VFX, and beyond.

Leading AI Innovators Trust QBO

“QBO exhibits metal performance across the board with all our ML/AI workloads.”

Simon McCormack VP Product, Drut

“With QBO, we took our Kubernetes cluster build-time down from 9 minutes to 70 seconds. It’s mind-blowing; I’ve never seen anything like it!”

Graham McGuiness Jigsaw24

“I don’t understand it cause in theory, it (a 60-second deployment) shouldn’t be possible!”

Riccardo Berardone Mobiliti Group

“To be able to deliver on our GTM strategy, we needed a lower and predictable infrastructure cost model, like QBO’s.”

Grahame Smee CEO, OpExx

Page.title: QBO Kubernetes Engine
Page._content:
QBO Kubernetes Engine

Streamline the deployment and management of Kubernetes clusters in seconds

Schedule a Discovery Meeting

Complexity Turns to Simplicity

QBO Kubernetes Engine (QBO) is QBO’s Kubernetes service. K8s has emerged as the industry standard for modern cloud computing, yet its deployment and management complexities are well-known. QBO redefines the concept of a Kubernetes node as a container with Kubernetes-in-Docker technology.

QBO Kubernetes Engine

Our QKE is engineered for optimal performance, delivering a seamless environment for deploying and managing Kubernetes clusters at scale.

NVIDIA GPU Operator Compatibility

Fully compatible with the NVIDIA GPU Operator, QKE lets you maximize GPU resources within your Kubernetes environment for high-performance workloads.

Kubernetes-in-Docker Redefined

QKE leverages Kubernetes-in-Docker (KinD) technology to redefine the concept of a Kubernetes node—enabling rapid deployment and simplified management of clusters in seconds.

Upstream Kubernetes, Powered by KinD Images

QKE runs upstream Kubernetes using officially supported KinD images, ensuring compatibility, stability, and fast iteration with the latest Kubernetes releases.

Deploy Anywhere

Designed for edge, on-prem, and hybrid environments, QKE delivers Kubernetes with full GPU acceleration—anywhere your workloads demand it.

Unlocking AI & ML Metal Performance with QKE

Harnessing GPU Power by deploying the Nvidia GPU Operator on QKE in just minutes – delivering unmatched bare metal performance for your most demanding workloads.
This streamlined setup process eliminates traditional deployment complexities while maximizing computational resources for AI/ML applications.

Leading AI Innovators Trust QBO

“QBO exhibits metal performance across the board with all our ML/AI workloads.”

Simon McCormack VP Product, Drut

“With QBO, we took our Kubernetes cluster build-time down from 9 minutes to 70 seconds. It’s mind-blowing; I’ve never seen anything like it!”

Graham McGuiness Jigsaw24

“I don’t understand it cause in theory, it (a 60-second deployment) shouldn’t be possible!”

Riccardo Berardone Mobiliti Group

“To be able to deliver on our GTM strategy, we needed a lower and predictable infrastructure cost model, like QBO’s.”

Grahame Smee CEO, OpExx

Page.title: Edge Cloud
Page._content:
Edge Cloud Power at the Data Source

Deploy high-performance cloud capabilities directly where your data is generated

Schedule a Discovery Meeting

How We Do It

Watch QBO’s high-performance compute solutions in action. Discover how QBO transforms the edge cloud landscape by bringing high-performance cloud capabilities directly to where data is generated.

An Edge Cloud Dilemma

Businesses struggle to extend cloud capabilities to the network edge without sacrificing performance, security, or operational consistency, often forcing compromises between latency, management complexity, and hardware limitations for edge deployments.

Smart Edge, Zero Compromise

QBO Edge Cloud delivers bare-metal performance with cloud-like orchestration at the network edge, eliminating traditional trade-offs.

Ultra-Low Latency Processing

Process data at the source with QBO's edge deployment capabilities. By eliminating both virtualization overhead and network transit, QBO enables real-time analytics, ML inference, and decision-making at the edge—ideal for IoT, industrial automation, and latency-sensitive applications.

Edge-to-Cloud Consistency

Maintain a unified operational model across your entire infrastructure landscape. QBO's containerized architecture creates consistency between edge and cloud deployments, enabling seamless workload portability and simplified management without environment-specific configurations.

Self-Contained Edge Platforms

Deploy complete cloud functionality in disconnected environments. QBO transforms any bare-metal server into a fully functional, self-contained edge platform with no external dependencies—perfect for remote locations, manufacturing floors, retail environments, and field operations.

Edge Security by Design

Secure sensitive data processing where it originates. QBO's process-level isolation and air-gapped deployment capabilities ensure edge workloads remain protected without relying on cloud connectivity or third-party security layers, meeting compliance requirements for data sovereignty and privacy.

Optimized Edge Resources

Maximize the value of limited edge hardware. QBO's containerized approach delivers significantly higher performance-per-watt than virtualized solutions, enabling sophisticated workloads on compact edge infrastructure while reducing power consumption and physical footprint.

Leading AI Innovators Trust QBO

“QBO exhibits metal performance across the board with all our ML/AI workloads.”

Simon McCormack VP Product, Drut

“With QBO, we took our Kubernetes cluster build-time down from 9 minutes to 70 seconds. It’s mind-blowing; I’ve never seen anything like it!”

Graham McGuiness Jigsaw24

“I don’t understand it cause in theory, it (a 60-second deployment) shouldn’t be possible!”

Riccardo Berardone Mobiliti Group

“To be able to deliver on our GTM strategy, we needed a lower and predictable infrastructure cost model, like QBO’s.”

Grahame Smee CEO, OpExx

QBO, the catalyst for edge cloud evolution

Ready to rethink how you deploy and manage edge cloud infrastructure?

Request Demo

Page.title: AI-ML
Page._content:
AI & ML Without Compromise

QBO, purpose-built for resource-intensive workloads with bare-metal performance and cloud agility

Schedule a Discovery Meeting

Advanced AI & ML Operations

Watch the Kubeflow seamlessly integrate with Nvidia GPU Operator in QBO Kubernetes Engine (QKE). This powerful combination delivers bare metal performance for AI & ML workloads – from training to inference and real-time processing.

Unique Demand from Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML)

AI & ML workloads demand resource-intensive environments with optimal performance, scalability, and responsiveness. Traditional cloud solutions introduce virtualization overhead that impedes direct hardware access, limiting computational efficiency when processing large datasets and complex models that AI/ML applications require.

Metal Performance for AI Workloads

Metal performance is crucial for AI workloads, ensuring optimal performance, scalability, and responsiveness. QBO provides direct access to metal resources, maximizing computational efficiency and performance outcomes, especially for processing large data sets and complex models.

Deployment in Seconds Rather Than Hours

QBO's intuitive interface and pre-configured workflows enable teams to deploy infrastructure in seconds rather than hours without the need for extensive training or specialized expertise. Launch complete Kubernetes clusters optimized for machine learning frameworks in under 70 seconds.

True Portability Across Environments

Free from vendor lock-in, QBO offers seamless portability across environments, enabling businesses to deploy and manage AI workloads in air-gapped, private, or hybrid setups. Move workloads freely between cloud providers while leveraging open standards instead of vendor-controlled infrastructure.

Performance Without Virtualization Overhead

Page.title: GPU Cloud
Page._content:
Democratized GPU Computing For All

Join the first community-powered GPU cloud where anyone can contribute, connect, and compute

Request Demo

Obstacles Turn to
Innovation

QBO understands that access to GPU cloud computing remains limited by high costs, centralized control, and rigid orchestration models that hinder experimentation and innovation. Developers and creators need a flexible, self-contained platform that eliminates barriers to entry while enabling seamless deployment across diverse environments.

Redefine GPU Cloud Access

Transforms cloud computing from an exclusive corporate resource into a global community asset

Community-Powered Resources

Access or contribute GPU power on your terms. As a participant, you can earn QBO units by sharing your GPU resources with the network or simply purchase units as needed, creating a self-sustaining ecosystem that grows stronger with each new member.

Zero-Cost Entry

Start with 300 free QBO units and scale as needed. QBO's commitment to accessibility means anyone can begin using enterprise-grade GPU infrastructure without upfront costs, democratizing access to the computational power previously reserved for large corporations.

Pay-Per-Second Economy

Only pay for the exact resources you consume. QBO units function as the currency of compute, calculated per second based on your usage of CPU, GPU, memory, and disk resources—ensuring transparent and equitable pricing for all participants.

Global Computing Movement

Join a mission to transform cloud computing. By becoming a LINK in the QBO GPU Cloud, you're not just accessing resources—you're helping build a new model of cloud infrastructure that's decentralized, inclusive, and community-owned.

Inclusive Cloud Architecture

Break down barriers to high-performance computing. QBO GPU Cloud allows anyone with GPU-enabled hardware to participate, transforming individual machines into LINKS that connect to the CORE and expand the cloud's collective capabilities.

Building The People's Cloud

As more users join as LINKs, the cloud’s capacity grows organically. This community-powered approach
creates a scalable, decentralized infrastructure that becomes more powerful with each new participant.

Step 1: The CORE Foundation

The CORE serves as the central coordination system that connects all LINKs, orchestrating distributed compute resources and running the ORIGIN deployments that seed and sustain the network.

Step 2: Become a LINK

Transform your GPU-enabled hardware into a community resource by creating a LINK. Your system connects to the CORE through MC2 (Metal Cloud Compute) instances, extending the cloud’s capabilities while earning you QBO units.

Step 3: QBO Units Economy

Access or contribute resources through QBO units—the cloud’s compute currency. Purchase units directly or earn them by sharing your GPU resources, with usage calculated per-second based on actual resource consumption.

Step 4: Seamless Scaling

As more users join as LINKs, the cloud’s capacity grows organically. This community-powered approach creates a scalable, decentralized infrastructure that becomes more powerful with each new participant.

Leading AI Innovators Trust QBO

“QBO exhibits metal performance across the board with all our ML/AI workloads.”

Simon McCormack VP Product, Drut

“With QBO, we took our Kubernetes cluster build-time down from 9 minutes to 70 seconds. It’s mind-blowing; I’ve never seen anything like it!”

“I don’t understand it cause in theory, it (a 60-second deployment) shouldn’t be possible!”

Riccardo Berardone Mobiliti Group

“To be able to deliver on our GTM strategy, we needed a lower and predictable infrastructure cost model, like QBO’s.”

Grahame Smee CEO, OpExx

Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)
